DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Restaging Transurethral Resection of Bladder Tumor Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date related to when a restaging transurethral resection of a bladder tumor was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Restaging Transurethral Resection of Bladder Tumor Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Staging that is performed to determine the extent of cancer that has reoccurred following treatment or how the cancer responded to treatment._A surgical procedure used to treat bladder tumors, during which a resectoscope is passed through the urethra and into the bladder._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredName: Restaging Transurethral Resection of Bladder Tumor Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: Staging that is performed to determine the extent of cancer that has reoccurred following treatment or how the cancer responded to treatment.:A surgical procedure used to treat bladder tumors, during which a resectoscope is passed through the urethra and into the bladder.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: Staging that is performed to determine the extent of cancer that has reoccurred following treatment or how the cancer responded to treatment.
A surgical procedure used to treat bladder tumors, during which a resectoscope is passed through the urethra and into the bladder.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/29/2020: CM Released as part of draft content review

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
